page.title: 18Childrens Games in Sharlston
page.content: Boys and girls in Sharlston play many different games. Many games are played with balls, such as rugby and ball-tigs. There are many rope games as well, like skipping and skipping rhymes. One of the most popular games is "Don't Miss a Looper". The boys fish in the dam and play on their BMX bikes on the common. In the autumn children collect nuts from the wood which is next to the dam. The common is very popular with the girls and boys. We also play indoor games like snakes and ladders and dolls. Girls also play rounders and netball. Both boys and girls play pegs. In this three sticks are balanced together and have to be knocked over by throwing a ball. Everyone reads books and draws pictures. Some children take their own dogs for a walk with a picnic.
